result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John J. Schwarzenberger

defendant.name: Schwarzenberger, John J.

records.addlTxt:
1:41 PM Defendant John J. Schwarzenberger in court.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court via zoom for John J. Schwarzenberger.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Atty Laufenberg acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading and waives time lines for PH. Def. is in agreeance. Court accepts waiver of time limits. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 032144,
Payable Number: 67081,
Receipt Number: 22R 003809,
Amount: $20.00
Def. to comply with Langlade County Department of Human Services.

2:20 PM Defendant John J. Schwarzenberger in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. has retained counsel, Atty Laufenberg. Court has not yet received notice of retainer. State is in compliance with victim rights. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests $5,000.00 signature bond with condition that Def. comply with Langlade County Department of Human Services. Def. is in agreeance. Court orders $5,000.00 signature bond with condition to comply with Langlade County Department of Human Services.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
